solution_line_template: Tom ideally wants to sleep {ideal_sleep_per_night} hours a night for {days_in_week} days, {ideal_sleep_per_night} x {days_in_week} = <<{ideal_sleep_per_night}*{days_in_week}={ideal_total_sleep}>>{ideal_total_sleep} hours sleep total for the week.

Tom has actually only slept {actual_sleep_weeknight} hours each weeknight, {actual_sleep_weeknight} x {weeknights_per_week} = <<{actual_sleep_weeknight}*{weeknights_per_week}={actual_sleep_weeknights_total}>>{actual_sleep_weeknights_total} hours of sleep.

Tom has only slept {actual_sleep_weekend_night} hours each night on the weekend, {actual_sleep_weekend_night} x {weekend_nights_per_week} = <<{actual_sleep_weekend_night}*{weekend_nights_per_week}={actual_sleep_weekend_total}>>{actual_sleep_weekend_total} hours of sleep.

Total, Tom has gotten {actual_sleep_weeknights_total} + {actual_sleep_weekend_total} hours = <<{actual_sleep_weeknights_total}+{actual_sleep_weekend_total}={actual_total_sleep}>>{actual_total_sleep} hours sleep.

The difference between how many hours Tom would like to sleep, {ideal_total_sleep}, and how many hours he's actually slept, {actual_total_sleep}, is {ideal_total_sleep} - {actual_total_sleep} = <<{ideal_total_sleep}-{actual_total_sleep}={sleep_deficit}>>{sleep_deficit} hours of sleep that Tom is behind on.
